alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Vermilion (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 29 at 10:51PM CDT until August 30 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Champaign County in east central Illinois... Southern Vermilion County in east central Illinois... * Until 200 AM CDT. * At 1051 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Champaign, Urbana, Savoy, St. Joseph, Georgetown, Westville, Tilton, Catlin, Oakwood, Sidney, Homer, Ridge Farm, Ogden, Fairmount, Fithian, Belgium, Muncie, Royal, Indianola and Jamaica. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
